title: Does domestic violence mean only physically beating or seriously injuring the  female in a domestic relationship?
content:
No, domestic violence not only includes physical violence (beating, torture, causing

physical injury), but also includes the following:

 - Sexual abuse of female (rape, including having sex with the female partner in

domestic relationship without her consent; forcing to view pornography or

obscene material; any act of sexual nature to humiliate or degrade or violate

her dignity; physical attack on sexual organs, forced sexual activity, female

genital mutilation, child sexual abuse)

 - Verbal and emotional abuse (name calling; using bad or abusing language

for the female or her kith and kin; taunts; insult for not bringing dowry, insult

for not having a male child, forcing you to get married against your will,

preventing you from marrying person of your choice, preventing you from

taking up a job, emotional black mail)

 - Economic abuse (forcing to quit a job; depriving from final means and bare

necessities of life; disturbing at the place of employment; forcing her to meet

any unlawful demand or dowry, forcibly taking away your salary, selling your

stridhan, not allowing you to take up employment)

Threat to cause any of the above types of violence qualifies as domestic

violence.

Everyday examples:

 - Slapping

 - Forced sexual relations

 - Getting daughter married forcefully

 - Calling the women names

 - Refusing to give money

 - Preventing from taking a job

 - Preventing from going out

 - Asking dowry
